subject: Football
event:
Life is meaningless and full of pain.

'Nuff said.

comments.upictitle: An Internet person, on the Internet: I am the sun
comments.article:
I hear writing helps get your mind off of the terrible losses!


Kidding, kidding! Have a cup of hot cocoa and a nice lemoncake, and the world will be well once again. ;)
I'd go for the Johnnie Walker Gold and Vermont Cheddar. But, that's just me.
Very bad day all around; the G-Men ruined my day
comments.subject: Football

comments.article: The New Orleans offense is an utter beast.
They really are.  It's almost disturbing how productive they are - and with the NO secondary actually playing football again, they're a tough, tough team to beat.

comments.subject: Re: i keep repeating "must not gloat"

comments.article:
Same thing with me, only in baseball, where I'm a fan of the SF Giants and the Oakland A's. Worse in baseball because they play 162 games and, more than likely, one or the other will lose on any given day...especially in the last few years.

Hopefully, this is just a blip on the way to a Jets-Giants Super Bowl eh? :-)

It's okay to like both the Giants and the A's?

In NY, you'd get killed if you liked the Yankees and the Mets. Killed.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: howler monkey
comments.article: Yeah, it was ugly.

The Giants are a good team who had a bad day on a day that New Orleans had a great day.

Now, just go beat the Falcons for us.....

I'd rather be the Giants and get blown out by the Saints than be the Eagles and lose a close one to the lowly Raiders!  That and the fact that the Redskins lost this weekend were my silver linings for this weekend.  The Giants remain in the driver's seat for the NFC East.  The season is young and this team will get healthier and improve.  I'm not worried.  5-1 is a good start.

Unfortunately, I have to agree with this comment.

I'm an Eagles fan, and I think I speak for the whole city when I say that we've pretty much given up on football this season. It just ain't gonna happen, especially if we can lose to the Raiders of all people. Humiliating. Luckily for our pride, we still have baseball :D

Yes, yes it is.

At least your teams didn't lose to the Raiders... *sigh*
This is what you get for killing Starks

i know how you feel. i just had a few days for it to wear off. i like college football and arkansas got screwed out of beating the number one team in the nation. i wanted to die after that game. well at least alabama won.

does anyone here ever watch college football?
comments.subject: footballl

comments.article:
Arkansas actually screwed themselves out of winning over Florida. I watched the whole game...it was theirs to win. They blew it for a multitude of reasons.

Bama and Texas scraped out wins too...watched those games as well. The difference was Bama and Texas actually won those games on their own play. Florida really won their game on costly mistakes by Arkansas.
comments.subject: Re: footballl

comments.article: To add injury to insult, Jenkins is gone for the year.  ;_;
Aww that sad little baby face
There is a bright side: Thomas Jones. That man was on fire. It was a loss, but if he can keep that up, it'll be very good for the Jets.
Kris Jenkins is the worst news, IMO. I foresee a marked weakening of the Jets defense, and its too damn bad.

well, I never expected that result with the giants, I have to say.

Sorry about the Jets.Ugh.
My house wasn't very pleasant when the Eagles lost and then I heard the Giants didn't do well and I thought "oh George isn't going to be happy when he catches up on his tivo".
I am a Bills fan and I can't believe that we won such a horribly played football game.  Both teams have a long way to go if we want to unseat the Cheatriots as tops in the division.
Wow, you have no idea how much I agree with this post...

To come home to that...

Jets, gone is the aura of Rex being the great game coach or Mark being the other Messiah. At least for this season. Matt Cavanaugh has his work cut out for him. I'm a bit more patient than I was with Coughlin and Eli. That game, you chalk up to growing pains.

Gints, I hear that C.C. Brown will be changing his name to Elvis Patterson. Bill Sheridan should be ashamed. I haven't seen a Giant defense without the inability to adjust since Eli's first two seasons. It goes back to the fact that they lack a very good LB corp. Yes, I know Ross and Phillips are out. So is Michael Boley. But, you have to recognize that C.C. was ineffective in his role. Geez! Commit him to the rush and drop Kiwi back from time to time. Something! Anything! I know they were overly concerned about the Saints rushing game, but come on. What about Brees and his receiving corp was a mystery? Giants have not been that embarrassed since 1980 when the great Dan Fouts carved them up. That should give us hope, I guess. That team had Brad Van Pelt, Harry Carson, George Martin and Mark Haynes.

I know folks want to give the Saint's offense a lot of credit, but really it just came down to scheme. Even with the injuries the Giants had the personnel to manage that offense. This was one game where you have to give all the credit to the coaches. And I suppose Drew Brees. I've always liked him and was shocked when SD brought Rivers in.

The Giants really need an upgrade in their line backers. Jerry's been great at getting talent and Boley was a great pickup. They need one more. Pierce, you know how I feel about him.

I'm done ranting, sorry. At least the Eagle lost... to the Raiders! Now I feel better.
I understand the G-men. New Orleans looked great. But the Jets? That was bad.
This is true, but it has very little, in fact, to do with football.
Six and Oh baby!
I wish I could say I feel your pain, but as I don't actually expect my team to win anymore ....
0-10, that's what I hear.

...but I'm just too proud not to gloat a little. I'm a Purdue grad so I do kinda like the Saints. I was there when Drew Brees was making a name for himself as a Boilermaker. Good weekend overall for my school: we beat Ohio State, Brees wins, Orton wins. We rarely get these moments so time for Boiler-nation to live it up.
comments.subject: Sorry George...

comments.upictitle: Machine wash warm with like colors.: pic#17109148
comments.article: Just be glad you don't live in Detroit like me.
